sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of High Shear Mixer for intensive mixing, kneading, and wet granulation of pharmaceutical powders using high-speed impeller and chopper action.
sections.scope: Applicable to high shear mixing and granulation activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the high shear mixer is installed on a stable foundation.
Verify all electrical connections, interlocks, and safety systems are functional.
Check that the mixing bowl, impeller, chopper, and lid are clean and properly assembled.
Weigh all ingredients accurately according to the batch formula.
Load powder ingredients into the mixing bowl.
Close and secure the bowl lid with proper safety interlocks engaged.
Set impeller speed to low (50-200 rpm) for initial dry mixing.
Start the impeller and allow dry powders to mix uniformly.
Continue dry mixing for specified time (typically 2-5 minutes).
Prepare granulating fluid or binder solution of appropriate concentration.
Connect spray nozzle or prepare for manual addition of binder.
Set chopper speed to desired level (typically 1000-3000 rpm).
Start the chopper while maintaining impeller rotation.
Begin spraying or adding granulating fluid at controlled rate.
Monitor power consumption and wet mass appearance during granulation.
Adjust impeller speed if necessary (typically increase to 200-400 rpm).
Continue granulation until desired endpoint is achieved.
Monitor endpoint using visual observation, power consumption, or temperature.
Stop chopper and impeller once granulation is complete.
Discharge wet granules immediately through the discharge valve.
Clean all product contact parts thoroughly with appropriate cleaning agents.
Inspect equipment for residue or product buildup.
Document all mixing parameters, fluid volume, and observations in the batch record.
precautions: Do not exceed maximum bowl capacity to ensure proper mixing.
Add granulating fluid at controlled rate to avoid over-wetting.
Monitor granulation endpoint carefully to achieve optimal granule properties.
Avoid over-processing which generates excessive heat and fine particles.
Never open the lid while impeller or chopper is in motion.
Ensure safety interlocks are functioning before operation.
Discharge wet mass promptly to prevent drying in the bowl.
Clean equipment immediately after use to prevent material hardening.
Wear appropriate PPE including gloves, safety goggles, and protective clothing.
Follow lockout/tagout procedures during cleaning and maintenance.
